intro: Bolbitis hastata, commonly known as the giant horsetail, is a fern-like plant native to North America. It belongs to the Equisetaceae family and is characterized by its tall, segmented stems and whorled leaves. The plant has a unique ability to photosynthesize through its leaves while also absorbing water and nutrients through its rhizomes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Bolbitis hastata is known for its historical use in traditional medicine and its ecological role in soil stabilization.
